singleLine.text: Palissade Collection by Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec

children.textContent: The Palissade Collection, designed by Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec for HAY, offers a range of sleek and durable outdoor furniture crafted from steel. This collection includes chairs, benches, tables, and lounge sofas, all designed to blend seamlessly into both natural and urban environments while providing timeless style and comfort.
Elegant and minimalist aesthetics that transcend trends.
Crafted from high-quality steel for lasting outdoor use.
Suitable for various outdoor spaces, from gardens to cafes.
Designed for optimal relaxation and support.
Built to withstand the elements and maintain its beauty.

json.textContent: Designed by French brothers Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec, this outdoor collection is united by its visual simplicity and core strength. It’s designed in colour and form to integrate effortlessly into a natural landscape or urban setting.

Adding extra comfort and functionality to Palissade’s collection of chairs and benches, the Palissade Soft Quilted Cushion is specially formed to fit the majority of the Palissade models. Crafted in fabric with a water-repellent finish, the cushion features an anti-slip backing and is filled with a soft and thick foam crumb and silicon fibre ball padding. The fabric has a high UV resistance, meaning it is fade-resistant with good colour fastness properties. The cushions are available in three colours and can be used all year round.

Discover the Palissade lounge sofa, a masterful creation by French designers Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec for HAY. This piece combines sleek, geometric design with exceptional durability, crafted from powder-coated or hot-galvanised steel. Perfect for both urban and natural settings, the Palissade lounge sofa offers sophisticated comfort and style for any outdoor space.

The Palissade lounge sofa embodies the visionary design ethos of French brothers Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec, crafted for HAY to transform outdoor living. With its elegant yet robust construction, this sofa is a testament to the beauty of symmetrical geometry and minimalist aesthetics. Made from either powder-coated or hot-galvanised steel, the Palissade lounge sofa is built to withstand the rigors of outdoor environments while maintaining its refined look.

Designed to seamlessly integrate into various settings—from chic city terraces to tranquil garden retreats—the Palissade lounge sofa provides not just seating but a sophisticated lounging experience. Its clean lines and balanced proportions create a visually striking piece that complements any outdoor décor.

Over time, the sofa's resilient materials will develop a unique patina, adding to its charm and character. This piece is more than just furniture; it’s an investment in enduring style and comfort, designed to become an integral part of your outdoor living space for years to come. Whether hosting a lively gathering or enjoying a quiet moment, the Palissade lounge sofa offers an inviting blend of elegance and practicality.

Timeless Elegance in Every Outdoor Setting

Designed by French brothers Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec, Palissade is a collection of outdoor furniture for HAY in powder coated or hot galvanised steel. United by a common principle of symmetrical geometry, the Palissade collection is engineered to reproduce the same visual simplicity and core strength throughout. Designed in colour and form to integrate effortlessly into a natural landscape or urban setting, Palissade is intended to be used over a longer period of time and become more beautiful over the years. The collection is suited to a wide variety of environments, from cafés and restaurants to gardens, terraces and balconies
Powder coated steel with a two-component coating; a primer and an outdoor powder coating which provides a barrier to corrosive elements, making it suitable for outdoor use

HAY focuses on developing long-lasting products that minimise our environmental impact. We optimise the use of sustainable materials such as recycled materials, FSC-certified wood and water-based lacquer, with a growing number of eco-certified products. We have strict regulatory requirements, and the majority of our products are tested to comply with international standards for strength, durability and safety

Our Care & Maintenance offers guidance for optimal maintenance of your HAY product. It includes advice and instructions on cleaning and caring for specific materials to prolong the life of your furniture. Find the guide at hay.com.
Take care not to scratch the chairs against each other when stacking them. Do not move or drag the chairs around when stacked as the weight will damage the legs.

singleLine.text: How to Create a Zen Garden with Minimalist Furniture and Plants

json.textContent: A Zen garden is a space designed to foster tranquility and mindfulness, making it a perfect escape from the stress of daily life. With minimalist furniture and carefully selected plants, you can create a peaceful oasis in your backyard or patio. This article will guide you through the essential steps to design your very own Zen garden.

Minimalism is key when designing a Zen garden. Opt for furniture with clean lines and simple shapes to avoid overwhelming the space. Low seating arrangements like wooden benches or cushions placed on stone platforms blend seamlessly into the garden's natural environment. Using neutral-colored furniture, such as beige, gray, or natural wood tones, further contributes to the calm, minimalist aesthetic.

title.text: The Art of Minimalist Furniture in Zen Gardens

json.textContent: Plants are integral to a Zen garden, as they symbolize growth, life, and renewal. Bamboo, moss, and ferns are common in Zen-inspired designs due to their soft, soothing presence. Opt for plants that require minimal care but offer maximum visual impact, such as Japanese maples, which add striking color and texture. Incorporating small water features, like a pond or fountain, enhances the calming atmosphere with the sound of trickling water.

A key element in many Zen gardens is the inclusion of pathways for mindful walks. These paths can be made of stepping stones, gravel, or smooth wooden planks and should guide you through the garden at a leisurely pace. Incorporating small benches or resting areas along the path encourages moments of reflection and stillness, helping you connect with your surroundings.

A Zen garden relies on the balance between hardscape elements (such as stone, wood, and gravel) and softscape elements (such as plants, moss, and sand). Use natural stones to create boundaries, define areas, or form focal points within the garden. The softscaping—your plants and greenery—should be carefully placed to accentuate the hard elements without overpowering them, maintaining harmony and balance throughout.

Designing a Zen garden requires thoughtful choices that prioritize simplicity, balance, and mindfulness. By incorporating minimalist furniture, soothing plants, and serene pathways, you can create a space that serves as a personal sanctuary, promoting peace and calm in your daily life.

title.text: Closing Thoughts: A Sanctuary of Calm

singleLine.text: Designing Your Outdoor Oasis: Furniture and Plant Pairings

json.textContent: Your outdoor space is an extension of your home, and with the right design, it can become a place of relaxation and joy. From selecting the perfect furniture to incorporating plants that enhance your garden’s beauty, creating a harmonious balance is key. In this article, we’ll show you how to pair outdoor furniture with plants to design a space that feels like a personal retreat.

Before you choose furniture or plants, consider how you want to use your outdoor area. Do you need a space for entertaining, relaxing, or dining? Knowing the purpose will help you select the right pieces to meet your needs.

Durable, weather-resistant materials like teak, metal, or wicker are ideal for outdoor furniture. Whether you're looking for a large dining table or a cozy set of lounge chairs, it's important to choose furniture that fits your lifestyle.

title.text: Defining the Purpose of Your Outdoor Space

json.textContent: Plants are essential in transforming your outdoor space. Use large potted plants or trees to create privacy, and choose flowering plants for pops of colour. Mixing textures with ferns, succulents, and trailing plants can create visual interest.

title.text: Adding Plants for Colour and Texture

json.textContent: Accessories like cushions, outdoor rugs, and lighting add comfort and style to your outdoor space. Soft furnishings can make your outdoor furniture more inviting, while lanterns and string lights create a cozy ambiance at night.

When designing your outdoor oasis, balance is key. Ensure that neither the plants nor the furniture overwhelms the space, and choose items that complement each other to create a harmonious, inviting atmosphere.

title.text: Creating Balance Between Furniture and Plants
